reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Syria and Surrounding Countries: Conflict Reduction and Mitigating Regional Spill-over

description.narrative: The Syrian civil war has very real local roots, but it is increasingly connected, both in terms of contributing dynamics and consequences, at regional level in the Middle East. This project aims to flexibly address the various levels of the Syria and relat ed regional crisis, in areas of conflict prevention and resolution that are CMI?s core expertise, and based on established and emerging networks in the region. The project will seek to provide support and capacity building to key institutions and stakehold er groups in neighbouring states, such as Jordan, Iraq and Lebanon, while also enabling dialogue and mediation among relevant parties in these states, as well as Syrians within and outside the country. In addition, the project encompasses discussions among interested regional parties, to increase trust and create an informal space for proposing ideas for mitigating and solving the conflict.
